p: Eculizumab is a humanized monoclonal IgG antibody that binds to the C5 complement protein, preventing cleavage into C5a and C5b. Blocking the formation of C5b prevents terminal complex C5b-9 or membrane attack complex (MAC) from subsequent formation. In the United States, eculizumab is approved for treating paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria and atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome [ 82, 83].
